plot: Allison begins acting compulsively after dreaming about the murder of a judge years before.

After Allison dreams of an unidentified radical anti-government activist from the 1980s, she finds that the police are investigating the death of the same man who was found that day in a local garbage dump. The man is eventually identified as Mitchell Slocum who set off a large fertilizer bomb in a Federal building in the 1980s killing 17 people. Soon Allison develops strange obsessions and finds herself buying a variety of items she sees glowing on store shelves. Joe is disturbed by her obsessive behavior but particularly by the fact that her dreams reveal a possible connection between Slocum and his newest - and only - employee, David Brewer.—garykmcd

When a man she sees commit a murder in a dream shows up dead himself, Allison seems to be under a spell, using junked electronics and home-improvement-store bought items to construct something in her garage. Meanwhile Allison's visions lead to the questioning of Joe's newly hired whiz of a partner which stretches Joe's patience with her.—Ron Kerrigan <mvg@whidbey.com>
